wikipedia_page.main: George Archibald Walters (30 March 1939 – December 2015) was a Scottish footballer, who played as a left winger in the English Football League.

response: *George Walters (VC) (1829–1872), English recipient of the Victoria Cross

Walters was best known for his time at Clyde where he made over 230 appearances, and was part of the 1957–58 Scottish Cup winning team.Joe Walters He then moved to Albion Rovers.Newcastle Fans His brother, George Walters, played for Clyde and Oldham Athletic.
